business.headline: New insurance rules: Will claim settlements improve for policyholders?The new insurance laws strengthen oversight and enforcement. In this special report, IndiaToday.in examines whether that will actually improve claim settlements for policyholders.
Silver slips after hitting record high of Rs 2.04 lakh/kg in Delhi, gold flatSpot silver was trading 0.56 per cent higher at USD 65.85 per ounce in the overseas trade.

From ports to airports: What pushed Adani Group into aviationJeet Adani, Gautam Adani's younger son and a director at Adani Airports, said the experience gained in ports and logistics helped the group enter aviation with confidence.

Why Jeet Adani says resilience is the next big challenge for Indian aviationWhile speaking to India Today, Adani said that aviation is a fragile system in which even small issues can quickly escalate into major problems.

Navi Mumbai airport will be one of most sustainable airports in world: Jeet AdaniSpeaking in the 'Jab We Met' segment, Jeet Adani said development and ecology should not be viewed as opposing ideas. He said large infrastructure projects must grow in a way that protects natural systems, as this also helps safeguard long-term assets and operations.
Built for the future: Jeet Adani on how Navi Mumbai Airport changes Mumbai aviationJeet Adani said the new airport will unlock long-term growth and improve global connectivity for the city.

Avadhut Sathe gets interim relief as SAT defreezes accounts for expensesIn August, Sebi conducted a search-and-seizure operation at Avadhut Sathe's Karjat Trading Academy as part of a broader crackdown on financial influencers offering market advice without proper registration.
Sensex ends 447 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; RIL up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex added 447.55 points to close at 84,929.36, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 150.85 points to end at 25,966.40.

Got an SMS or email from the Income Tax Department? Here's what it meansGot an unexpected SMS or email from the Income Tax Department about your transactions and unsure what to do next? The department has clarified the purpose behind these alerts.

Adani Group to bid for 11 airports amid India's air travel boom: ReportThe Indian government has been leasing out government-owned airports on long-term contracts to private companies. At the same time, it is encouraging the construction of new airports to improve connectivity across the country.

8th Pay Commission update: How big could be the salary hike and what to expectHere's what central government employees can realistically expect from the 8th Pay Commission now that the 7th CPC's term ends in December 2025 and when the cash might actually hit bank accounts.

ICICI Prudential AMC makes strong debut: What long, short-term investors should doICICI Prudential AMC share price: The listing was slightly below grey market expectations. Ahead of the debut, the IPO was commanding a grey market premium of Rs 520–530, which had indicated possible listing gains of around 24%.

ICICI Prudential AMC shares list at 20% premium: Hold or sell?Shares of ICICI Prudential AMC debuted at Rs 2,606.20 on the BSE, marking a premium of 20.38% over the IPO issue price of Rs 2,165. On the NSE, the stock opened at around Rs 2,600, up 20.09%.
Sensex jumps 500 points: 3 reasons why stock market is rising today?At around 9:45 am, the S&P BSE Sensex jumped 525.11 points to 85,006.92, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 147.50 points to 25,963.30.

Ola Electric shares fall over 60% this year: What should investors do?The stock has now fallen nearly 63% in calendar year 2025, making it one of the worst-performing newly listed technology stocks this year. Ola Electric shares hit a fresh 52-week low of Rs 31.54 on Thursday.

Japan's central bank raises rates to 0.75%, highest in 30 yearsThe Bank of Japan raised its short-term policy rate to 0.75% from 0.5%, its first rate hike since January. In a statement, the Bank of Japan said that even after the hike, financial conditions would remain supportive for the economy

How aluminium is changing the job story in India's mineral-rich statesIndustry estimates cited by the Aluminium Association of India show that the sector has already generated over eight lakh jobs and supports 4,000 SMEs in its downstream ecosystem.
Sensex opens 300 points higher, Nifty above 25,900; Infosys up 1%The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 525.11 points to 85,006.92, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 147.50 points to 25,963.30 as of 9:45 am.

ICICI Prudential AMC IPO listing today: Is GMP pointing to gains for investors?The ICICI Prudential AMC IPO saw very strong demand during its three-day bidding period. The issue was subscribed 39.17 times overall.

Your SIP stayed at Rs 5,000 over the years. How not increasing it 10% cost you lakhsYour salary rose, expenses changed, but your SIP remained at Rs 5,000. Over time, this small choice can quietly cost you several lakhs in missed wealth. Let's understand how.

entertainment.headline: Medical team clears Nora Fatehi after accident on way to David Guetta concert: Report Nora Fatehi suffered a slight concussion after a car accident on her way to David Guetta's Sunburn 2025 concert in Mumbai. She was subsequently cleared by the medical team, according to reports.

Dhurandhar actor Danish Pandor reacts to Hrithik Roshan's view on film's politics Dhurandhar actor Danish Pandor has responded to Hrithik Roshan's review of the film, saying its political and terror-related elements are backed by research and undeniable facts.

They hadn't seen my films: Madhuri Dixit on sons discovering her stardom in college  Madhuri Dixit shared that her sons Arin and Ryan didn't watch most of her films while growing up, leaving their college friends shocked by the revelation.

Zeeshan Ayyub on interfaith marriage to Rasika Agashe: Love takes care of everything Zeeshan Ayyub opened up about his interfaith marriage to Rasika Agashe, saying it felt natural as he grew up with a Hindu mother and Muslim father.

Kangana Ranaut calls Aditya Dhar the real Dhurandhar after watching the film Kangana Ranaut praised Aditya Dhar's Dhurandhar, calling the filmmaker the true "Dhurandhar" of the film as it continues its strong box office run.

Hrithik Roshan's Uttarakhand trek includes visit to Santala Devi temple. Pics Hrithik Roshan was seen offering prayers at the Santala Devi temple in Dehradun during his recent trekking trip in Uttarakhand.

Keep the Tricolor flying high: Parineeti Chopra hosts champion Harmanpreet Kaur Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha hosted Indian women's cricket team captain Harmanpreet Kaur at their Mumbai home, celebrating her achievements and humility.

Mohanlal breaks down while paying tribute to Sreenivasan, videos go viral Mohanlal, along with Sathyan Anthikad, paid his last respects to veteran actor-filmmaker Sreenivasan at Ernakulam Town Hall, with emotional visuals of the actor going viral.

After 43 years, Bhojpuri classic Nadiya Ke Paar to return on the big screen The 1982 Bhojpuri classic Nadiya Ke Paar is returning to the big screen after 43 years with a special screening in Patna to reconnect Bihar's youth with their cultural roots.

Breakdown 1975 review: The chaos that created New Hollywood's daring peak Morgan Neville's 'Breakdown: 1975', vividly traces how the chaos of Vietnam, Watergate, and the rise of the Reagan era reshaped American cinema. Here's our review.

Randeep Hooda's wife Lin Laishram talks about pregnancy after suffering miscarriage Lin Laishram opened up about her pregnancy with Randeep Hooda, revealing how the actor is lovingly preparing for fatherhood. The soon-to-be mother also shared that the couple went through a miscarriage earlier this year and are now embracing this phase with gratitude and joy.

B Praak and wife welcome baby boy after losing newborn in 2022 B Praak and his wife Meera have announced the birth of their second son, describing the event as a spiritual rebirth following the loss of their newborn in 2022. The couple shared the news on Instagram.

Radhika Apte recalls uncomfortable on-set demand during South film shoot Radhika Apte praised South Indian cinema for its strong storytelling while recalling an uncomfortable early experience of being the only woman on set.

Rajinikanth, Kamal Haasan, Mammootty and other celebs pay tribute to Sreenivasan Malayalam legend Sreenivasan died at 69 on Saturday after a prolonged illness. Several stars paid their heartfelt tributes to the actor, producer, and director.

Sunny, Bobby Deol remember Dharmendra after Ikkis final trailer: My precious papa Sunny Deol and Bobby Deol shared heartfelt tributes to their late father Dharmendra as the final trailer of Ikkis was unveiled online.

Cinema remembers the brave: Aditya Dhar reacts to Sandeep Vanga's Dhurandhar praise Aditya Dhar responded to Sandeep Reddy Vanga's glowing praise for Dhurandhar, calling it a meaningful validation of his filmmaking journey.

Korean couple Kim Woo-bin, Shin Min-a marry in Seoul after 10 years. First pic out Korean actors Kim Woo-bin and Shin Min-a got married at a private event in Seoul. Their agency shared the first picture from the intimate wedding.

Limbachiya and sons: Bharti-Haarsh announce arrival of baby boy in new video Comedian Bharti Singh and writer-husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa announced the arrival of their baby boy with a video on Saturday. This came following Bharti's hospitalisation due to a medical emergency.

Carries a masculine spine: Sandeep Vanga calls Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar powerful Director Sandeep Reddy Vanga shared his thoughts on Aditya Dhar's 'Dhurandhar', commending Ranveer Singh and Akshaye Khanna's performances. The Bollywood action film has received notable attention for its depiction of violence and the strength of its cast.

general news.headline: Osman Hadi will live in our hearts: Yunus vows to follow anti-India leader's idealsBangladesh chief advisor Muhammad Yunus vowed to follow anti-India student leader Osman Hadi's ideals while paying tribute at his funeral, as Hadi's associates demanded swift action against his killers in 24 hours.

Does India need more Jaishankar? Foreign Minister gives Lord Hanuman analogyResponding to whether India needs more than one Jaishankar, S Jaishankar said the premise was flawed, stressing that nations are defined by leadership and vision, drawing a parallel with Lord Hanuman serving Ram.

At least 16 files related to Epstein vanish from DOJ website with no public noticeAt least 16 Epstein-related files vanished from a DOJ website without explanation, fueling speculation and frustration as key records stay missing and survivors still await full transparency.

This private factory wants to make one new space rocket every monthThis immersive story follows a full day spent inside the high-security facility where engineers, technicians, and scientists are racing against time to prepare Vikram-I, the startup's first orbital launch vehicle, for its upcoming space mission.

India Today from 1985-95: Insight at Bofors, Babri demolition, India's upheavalsIn a sweeping account of India's most turbulent decades, a key media figure recounts the nation's defining moments from 1985 to 1995 in this episode of IndiaToday@50 series.

Netanyahu to brief Trump on potential new Iran strikes: ReportIsraeli PM Netanyahu plans to urge Trump to consider action as Israel claims Iran is rebuilding missile production and nuclear sites damaged in earlier strikes, prompting renewed regional security concerns.

Delhi minister warns of bad weather, worsening air quality as AQI nears severeDelhi Environment Minister warned that a western disturbance is expected to hit the national capital, which could worsen weather conditions and increase pollution levels.
35 children injured as school bus hits divider, overturns in JammuAt least 35 children were injured when a school bus returning from a picnic overturned after hitting a divider in Jammu.

PM Modi inaugurates India's first nature-themed airport terminal in GuwahatiBuilt at a cost of Rs 4,000 crore, the terminal is the country's first nature-themed airport facility and is expected to handle over 13 million passengers annually, making it the largest in the northeastern region.

Delhi shivers in season's first cold wave; 129 flights cancelled amid dense smogDense fog and a persistent grey haze kept the sun mostly hidden throughout the day, causing major disruptions at Delhi airport, where at least 129 flights were cancelled, officials said.

Video: BJP MLA slaps auto-rickshaw driver for driving in wrong direction in MumbaiBJP MLA Parag Shah was allegedly involved in an altercation with an auto-rickshaw driver in Mumbai, during which he slapped the driver.

Bihar doctor whose hijab was removed by Nitish Kumar fails to join dutyThe doctor, whose hijab was removed by Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar during an appointment letter distribution event earlier this week, has not yet reported for duty even as the incident continued to trigger widespread outrage.

What is the Raccoon roundworm parasite detected in nine countries?A resilient parasite carried by raccoons is spreading across Europe, posing a severe neurological threat to humans. Experts warn that the infection often goes undiagnosed while raccoon populations continue to explode in urban areas.

Telangana to go Karnataka way, bring law against hate speechEarlier this week, the Karnataka Legislative Assembly cleared the Hate Speech and Hate Crimes Prevention Bill, 2025, amid loud protests from the Opposition.

Watch: India coach Gambhir refuses to answer query on Gill's T20 World Cup snubIndia coach Gautam Gambhir refused to answer questions about Shubman Gill's snub from the T20 World Cup 2026 after the squad was announced on Saturday, December 20. Gill was the surprise omission from the side as India will look to defend their title at home.

Why Osman Hadi has been buried beside Bangladesh national poet Kazi Nazrul IslamAnti-India radical leader Sharif Osman Hadi was buried beside the national poet of Bangladesh, Kazi Nazrul Islam, in Dhaka University. The decision was taken after requests from the office of Muhammad Yunus and the Jamaat Shibir-run Dhaka University students' body. However, Hadi's Inqilab Mancha said it was the leader's family's wish. But, many in Bangladesh see the move as a means to play with history, politics, and the meaning of legacy.

Watch: Blue Origin launches first wheelchair user to spaceBlue Origin's NS-37 mission has marked a historic first with Michaela Benthaus becoming the inaugural wheelchair user to travel to space alongside a diverse crew.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Medical team clears Nora Fatehi after accident on way to David Guetta concert: ReportNora Fatehi suffered a slight concussion after a car accident on her way to David Guetta's Sunburn 2025 concert in Mumbai. She was subsequently cleared by the medical team, according to reports.

SIR aimed at blocking infiltrators, deshdrohis defending them: PM jabs CongressPrime Minister Narendra Modi accused the Indian National Congress of neglecting Assam and the Northeast and protecting infiltrators, asserting that the BJP government was correcting decades-old mistakes and driving development in the region.
The diamond plot twist: Yellow is inOnce overlooked (and looked down upon), yellow diamonds are emerging as luxury's warmest trend.

South box office 2025: Malayalam peaks, Tamil and Telugu struggle, Kannada faltersSouth Indian cinema in 2025 showed clear divides with Malayalam films leading in content and Tamil industry facing challenges. The shift signals audiences favour quality storytelling, and star power alone no longer guarantees success.

PM bulldozed SHANTI Bill to restore peace with his 'friend' Trump: CongressCongress's Jairam Ramesh claimed Trump signing the US National Defence Authorization Act exposed the real reason behind what he described as the "bulldozing" of the SHANTI Bill through Parliament.

Be back after thrashing him: Flier recounts ordeal with Air India Express pilotSpeaking to India Today TV, Ankit Dewan said the confrontation began at a security checkpoint when the pilot, identified as Captain Virender, objected to his presence and made derogatory remarks.

sports.headline: Pakistan hockey in turmoil as players await due payment from authorities: Report Unpaid dues and financial instability continue to affect Pakistan's hockey players, with pending payments for camps, tours, and international participation from the national federation. National captain Ammad Shakeel Butt and other players highlight the impact on their careers and advocate for structural changes.

Ishan Kishan's respect for domestic cricket paved his World Cup comeback, says Ashwin R Ashwin says Ishan Kishan's T20 World Cup return is a result of his domestic grind, from Buchi Babu to SMAT, calling it a full-circle moment earned through discipline and respect for the game.

Watch: India coach Gambhir refuses to answer query on Gill's T20 World Cup snub India coach Gautam Gambhir refused to answer questions about Shubman Gill's snub from the T20 World Cup 2026 after the squad was announced on Saturday, December 20. Gill was the surprise omission from the side as India will look to defend their title at home.

T20 World Cup: How Kishan's call-up signals BCCI's change in selection mantra Sunil Gavaskar claims that Ishan Kishan's selection for the T20 World Cup 2026 shows that BCCI do value domestic cricket and is considering it as a part of the criteria for having players picked into the India squad.

With T20 World Cup as goal, right time to give youngsters chances: Harmanpreet Kaur IND-W vs SL-W, 1st T20I: Harmanpreet Kaur said India will use the Sri Lanka T20I series to give youngsters opportunities and prepare with a fearless mindset for the T20 World Cup.

Shubman Gill's T20 World Cup 2026 axe decided before Ahmedabad T20I: Report T20 World Cup 2026: Shubman Gill's sudden omission for the 2026 T20 World Cup has sparked debate, with form, fitness concerns and a late course correction leaving the opener out as Samson and Kishan step into the spotlight.

Satwik-Chirag's magical run in BWF World Tour finals end with semi-final loss Satwik-Chirag's incredible run at the BWF World Tour Finals came to an end in the semi-finals as they lost to China's Liang Wei Keng and Wang Chang in three games. The Indian pair end their 2025 without a title to their name.

New era for Zimbabwe cricket: Richard Ngarava named ODI and Test team captain Zimbabwe Cricket has announced key leadership changes, appointing Richard Ngarava as the new Test and ODI captain, with Brian Bennett stepping in as vice-captain. The board expressed confidence in the new leadership and paid tribute to outgoing captain Craig Ervine.

History beckons: Mandhana, Deepti eye huge records in Sri Lanka T20I series IND-W vs SL-W: Smriti Mandhana is looking to become the first Indian batter with 4000 Women's T20I runs while Deepti Sharma has a chance to become the all-time leading wicket-taker in the format.

Adipoli Chetta: Sanju Samson's inclusion in T20 World Cup squad leaves Ashwin pleasedR Ashwin's enthusiastic reaction to Sanju Samson's T20 World Cup return lit up social media, as the veteran spinner praised his 'thambi' and backed India's chances of defending their title in 2026.

Suryakumar Yadav will be back: India captain vows to regain form before T20 World CupIND vs SA: Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav struggled in T20Is in 2025, scoring just 218 runs in 19 innings at an average of 13.62, without a single half-century to his name.

England won't give up: Zak Crawley issues war cry despite Ashes hopes fadingDespite facing an almost certain series defeat, England's Zak Crawley insists the team will continue to fight and look for a win in the Adelaide Test. Australia are just four wickets away from claiming an Ashes series win.

When brilliance becomes a burden: The Suryakumar Yadav conundrumA genius in group matches but goes missing in action during knockouts, Suryakumar Yadav is at a crossroads when it comes to his T20I career. With the T20 World Cup 2026 just around the corner, can SKY strip away everything except the simple mandate to bat with the fearlessness that defined his rise.

Renuka Singh rejoices Lionel Messi meet: Two pairs of hands, two World CupsIndia pace bowler Renuka Singh Thakur, fresh off her ODI World Cup triumph, shared a memorable moment meeting football legend Lionel Messi during his G.O.A.T India Tour 2025, celebrating sporting excellence and inspiring fans across multiple cities.

IND vs PAK, U19 Asia Cup 2025 Final Live streaming: All you need to knowU19 Asia Cup 2025 final: India and Pakistan brace for a fiery Under-19 Asia Cup title clash, with rising stars and standout performances setting the stage for a high-pressure showdown that promises skill, rivalry and edge in equal measure.

Shubman Gill's T20 World Cup snub shows lack of clarity: Dinesh KarthikShubman Gill's snub from the T20 World Cup is a case of lack of clarity, according to Dinesh Karthik after the squad for the ICC event was announced on Saturday, December 20. Gill and Jitesh Sharma was dropped from the side despite playing the South Africa series.

Ishan Kishan's Bhagavad Gita-guided grind earns him T20 World Cup recallIshan Kishan's return to India's 2026 T20 World Cup squad marks a comeback built on resilience, domestic grind and a newfound sense of maturity after setbacks, scrutiny and spiritual reflection.

Watch: Ishan Kishan's first reaction to T20 World Cup selectionIshan Kishan returns to the Indian cricket team after a two-year hiatus. His domestic centuries and leadership helped him secure selection for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026.

Hope Shubman Gill takes T20 World Cup snub in right spirit: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar is hoping that Shubman Gill will take his T20 World Cup snub in the right spirit. Gill was dropped from the side despite being the vice-captain of the team after his patchy run of form with the bat.

What wrong did Jitesh Sharma do? Fans left fuming after T20 World Cup snubShubman Gill's omission grabbed attention, but Jitesh Sharma's exclusion has confused fans even more. Fresh off a strong IPL run with RCB, many believed he had done enough to earn a World Cup spot.

BCCI Announces T20 World Cup Squad: Shubman Gill Dropped from T20 World Cup 2026 SquadIn a significant development for Indian cricket, BCCI Chief Selector Ajit Agarkar announced the squad for the T20 World Cup 2026, confirming the exclusion of star batter Shubman Gill. Addressing the media, Agarkar explained that the decision was driven by team 'combinations' and the preference for a wicketkeeper-batter at the top of the order. Consequently, Axar Patel has been reappointed as the vice-captain. Agarkar stated, 'Someone has to miss out when you pick 15. And unfortunately, it's Gill at this point.' The squad also sees the inclusion of Rinku Singh and the return of Ishan Kishan, while Suryakumar Yadav continues to lead the side. The Chief Selector emphasized that the management wanted flexibility and depth, highlighting the role of all-rounders and wrist spinners in the upcoming tournament.

Why was Gill axed from T20 World Cup squad? Selector Ajit Agarkar explainsIndia's T20 World Cup 2026 squad announcement delivered a major surprise with Shubman Gill left out of the 15-member squad. However, the chief selector clarified that the decision was not a reflection of Gill's calibre.

Shubman Gill dropped, Ishan Kishan picked as BCCI announces T20 World Cup squadShubman Gill has been dropped as India named Axar Patel vice-captain in their squad for next year's T20 World Cup, co-hosted by India and Sri Lanka. Ishan Kishan has also been recalled following his standout performance in the Syed Mushtaq Ali Trophy final.

Australia leave England on the mat in Adelaide Test, edge closer to retaining AshesAshes: Australia are just four wickets away from winning the third Test at the Adelaide Oval and retaining the urn. England still need 228 runs with only four wickets in hand, and will have to produce something extraordinary to avoid defeat.

Kavem Hodge leads West Indies' strong fightback with classy hundred on Day 3Kavem Hodge led a determined West Indies fightback on day three, reaching his second Test hundred as the visitors closed at 381 for 6, still 194 runs behind New Zealand's first-innings total.

Mohammed Shami to lead Bengal's pace attack in Vijay Hazare TrophyExperienced pacer Mohammed Shami has been named in Bengal's squad for the Vijay Hazare Trophy following a strong domestic season. Shami, who has not featured for India recently, brings his impressive form to Bengal's campaign as the team prepares to compete in Elite Group B.

Anthony Joshua hands boxing reality check to Jake Paul with a 6th round KOAnthony Joshua delivered a brutal reminder of boxing's pecking order by stopping Jake Paul in Miami. The sixth-round knockout exposed the gap between elite heavyweight pedigree and crossover hype.

Shubman Gill should continue to open, Sanju Samson can bat at no 3: UthappaFormer India cricketer Robin Uthappa has backed Shubman Gill to continue as India's T20I opener despite poor form. He suggests Sanju Samson should bat at No 3 to strengthen the lineup ahead of the T20 World Cup.

Suryakumar needs just one good innings to reaffirm T20I calibre: TilakSuryakumar Yadav's prolonged lean patch has become India's lone T20 concern before a home World Cup. Teammate Tilak Varma believes one defining innings is enough to restore the skipper's fear factor.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
